text: Samsung’s innovation in the foldable smartphone market continues to generate buzz, with rumors swirling around two anticipated devices: the Galaxy Z Fold 7 and the tri-fold Galaxy G Fold. Both models aim to push the boundaries of mobile technology, offering unique features and designs that cater to different user preferences. Designer: Samsung Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7: Evolution of the Foldable Before we get to the tri-folds, here’s a brief update on the upcoming Galaxy Z Fold7. The device is expected to build upon the foundation laid by its predecessors, introducing subtle yet meaningful enhancements. Reports suggest that the device will maintain a similar design to the Z Fold6, with a focus on refining existing features rather than overhauling the design. This approach indicates Samsung’s commitment to perfecting the foldable experience. Samsung Galaxy Z Fold6 Special Edition Under the hood, the Z Fold7 is rumored to be powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, promising improved performance and efficiency. Additionally, it is expected to feature an upgraded speaker system, potentially offering better audio quality for media consumption. Storage options are expected to remain consistent, with configurations of 256GB, 512GB, and 1TB, all paired with 12GB of RAM. While these specifications mirror those of the Z Fold6, the upgraded processor could offer a noticeable boost in daily operations. In terms of display, the Z Fold7 may feature an 8-inch main screen, slightly larger than its predecessor’s 7.6-inch display. This screen will borrow improvements from the Special Edition variant for better screen clarity and usability. The cover display is also expected to see an increase, potentially reaching 6.5 inches. These adjustments aim to enhance the user experience, providing more screen real estate for multitasking and media consumption. Samsung Galaxy Z Fold6 Special Edition Pricing for the Z Fold7 is anticipated to remain in line with previous models, starting at around $1,899. However, some reports suggest a potential increase due to rising component costs. The official unveiling is expected during Samsung’s mid-2025 Unpacked event, typically held in July or August. Samsung’s foray into tri-fold technology is embodied in the rumored Galaxy G Fold. This device is expected to feature a unique G-shaped folding mechanism, allowing the smartphone to fold inward from both sides. When fully unfolded, the G Fold could offer a display nearing 10 inches, providing a tablet-like experience in a pocketable form factor. The G-shaped design aims to protect the internal display by keeping it enclosed when folded, potentially enhancing durability. This inward-folding approach contrasts with other designs that leave parts of the screen exposed, thereby reducing the risk of scratches and damage. While detailed specifications remain scarce, the G Fold is expected to compete directly with devices like Huawei’s Mate XT, which also explores tri-fold technology. Pricing is anticipated to be premium, possibly exceeding $2,000, reflecting its advanced design and capabilities. A limited production run of around 200,000 units is speculated, indicating Samsung’s cautious approach to this new form factor. Huawei Mate XT: The Original Tri-Fold Innovator The Huawei Mate XT tri-fold is ready to enter the global market as it has cleared the TDRA certification. The device has appeared on the UAE’s database, suggesting that Huawei may soon introduce the foldable for global consumers. Originally launched in September 2024, the Mate XT sparked speculations about a wider release, and recent rumors claim that it could debut globally in the first quarter of 2025. Designer: Huawei The Mate XT has received the UAE-based TDRA certification, which is a necessary step for telecommunication devices to be sold in the region. The listing shows that the device carries the model number GRL-LX9, with its registration valid until January 30, 2025. This certification strongly hints at an impending international launch. Huawei Mate XT: Specifications Mate XT features three display panels, each boasting a 90Hz refresh rate, 1440Hz high-frequency PWM dimming, 240Hz maximum touch response, and a P3 wide color gamut. The display configurations include: Single Screen 6.4-inch (2232 x 1008 pixels): 73.5 mm wide, 12.8 mm thick Double Screen 7.9-inch (2232 x 2048 pixels): 143.0 mm wide, 7.45 mm/4.75 mm thick Three-screen 10.2-inch (2232 x 3184 pixels): 219.0 mm wide, 3.6/3.6/4.75mm thick The device is powered by Huawei’s Kirin 9010 chipset and a 5600mAh battery, supporting 66W fast charging, 5W wired reverse charging, 50W wireless charging, and 7.5W wireless reverse charging. The Mate XT also includes a triple-camera setup with a 50MP main shooter, a 12MP ultra-wide lens, and a 12MP periscope sensor with 5.5x optical zoom. The 8MP front-facing camera supports various shooting modes for both photo and video content. Comparative Insights Several distinctions emerge when comparing the Galaxy Z Fold 7, Galaxy G Fold, and Huawei Mate XT. The Z Fold7 continues the traditional book-like fold, offering a balance between smartphone portability and expanded screen space. Its design refinements and hardware upgrades aim to enhance the user experience without drastic changes. Samsung Galaxy Ring and Fold6 The G Fold’s tri-fold mechanism represents a more radical innovation, targeting users seeking maximum screen real estate in a mobile device. The G-shaped fold not only increases display size but also prioritizes screen protection by folding inward. Meanwhile, the Mate XT challenges Samsung’s tri-fold entry with its own unique approach. With a global launch on the horizon, Huawei’s take on the tri-fold format will soon become available to a wider audience, possibly increasing competition in this emerging segment. As Samsung and Huawei explore these diverse foldable designs, we invite readers to share their thoughts. Does the refined approach of the Galaxy Z Fold7 appeal to your sense of familiarity and incremental improvement? Or does the ambitious design of the Galaxy G Fold’s tri-fold mechanism capture your imagination? Perhaps the Huawei Mate XT, with its imminent global release, is the device to watch. Your preferences and insights are valuable as we navigate the evolving landscape of mobile technology. Note: The information provided is based on current rumors and leaks. Official details from manufacturers may differ upon the devices’ release.
